summary_text: Prithvi Shaw scored 222 runs from 156 balls, including 29 boundaries and five sixes, maintaining a strike rate of 142.31. The Maharashtra batter now holds the record for the fastest double century in Ranji Trophy's elite competition in the 21st century. He surpassed his own previous record of 174 balls, set against Baroda in 2019/20 at the Reliance Stadium in Vadodara. Shaw joins Virender Sehwag as the second Indian to score multiple double hundreds in first-class cricket in under 200 balls.

LeBron James will not play for the Los Angeles Lakers against the Portland Trail Blazers. The 40-year-old is still recovering from a sciatic nerve injury. His absence leaves a noticeable void in both leadership and versatility.

General Motors has laid off more than 200 salaried employees, primarily Computer-Aided Design (CAD) engineers. The cuts, which took place Friday at the company's global tech campus in Warren, Michigan, come just days after the Detroit automaker raised its 2025 financial guidance. GM confirmed the layoffs were part of a broader reorganisation of its design engineering division.

India's AI market is on a meteoric rise, expected to reach $17 billion by 2027. India still faces a 51% demand-supply gap in AI and ML professionals. This gap presents a tremendous opportunity with 10x more projected jobs and 4x more higher salaries.

Global Indian International School (GIIS) is ranked Singaporeâ€™s #1 IB school in 2025. GIIS has produced 125+ world toppers and near-perfect scorers. More than 400 students have been placed in top universities, including Ivy League and Oxbridge.

A 21-year-old woman, her ex-boyfriend and his friend have been arrested for allegedly killing her live-in partner, a UPSC aspirant, in north Delhi's Timarpur. The trio allegedly thrashed and strangled Ramkesh Meena, before pouring oil, ghee and wine over his body. They allegedly stole the hard disk, two laptops and other items belonging to Meena.

The transfer orders for 61 IAS and 145 WBCS (Executive) officers were uploaded in the first half of the day. The officers will serve as key functionaries in the SIR exercise, and once the schedule is notified, any further transfers by the state would require EC approval. The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) questioned the timing of the transfers calling the "last-minute bulk transfers" an effort to "disturb the process (SIR)
